meanings.definition: The quality or state of being composed of three parts or elements.
meanings.sent1: The trimerism of the clover leaf fascinated the students during biology class.
meanings.sent2: The trimerism of the traffic lights ensured smooth flow at the intersection.
meanings.sent3: The trimerism of the triple-layered cake made it a delicious treat for the party guests.
meanings.sent4: The trimerism of the family's three pets brought harmony and joy to their home.
meanings.sent5: The trimerism of the primary colors is essential in creating a wide range of hues.

meanings.definition: The condition of having three-fold symmetry.
meanings.sent1: The trimerism of the snowflake's design was truly mesmerizing.
meanings.sent2: The trimerism of the kaleidoscope patterns delighted the children at the fair.
meanings.sent3: The trimerism of the three-tiered fountain added elegance to the garden.
meanings.sent4: The trimerism of the triangle's angles created a sense of balance in the artwork.
meanings.sent5: The trimerism of the spider's web showcased nature's intricate beauty.

meanings.definition: The property of having three similar parts or components.
meanings.sent1: The trimerism of the necklace's design made it a popular choice among customers.
meanings.sent2: The trimerism of the musical chord gave the song a harmonious sound.
meanings.sent3: The trimerism of the traffic signal colors helped drivers navigate the roads.
meanings.sent4: The trimerism of the story's plot twists kept the audience engaged till the end.
meanings.sent5: The trimerism of the plant's leaves added symmetry to the garden bed.
